intro: Cephalophorus, commonly known as the crown flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Cephalophorus species are native to regions in the Mediterranean and parts of southern Europe. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant colors and distinctive floral structure.
